intro: Descurainia tenuissima, commonly known as slender wallflower, is a low-growing annual plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has thin, hairy stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, spherical pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
